intro: Menyanthes campestris, commonly known as the marsh woundwort, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Geraniaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, floating leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle, which helps it thrive in wetland environments. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is typically found in marshes, fens, and along the edges of ponds and streams. Menyanthes campestris is an important component of wetland ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
